helper.SUMESS:
💠  *How add numbers to the sudo without going to heroku*  💠  

❇️ Make the numbers that you want to set sudo as, 94704296532 
(International format wothout *+* and *spaces*)
❇️ .setvar sudo=94xxxxxxxxx,0,

ᴋɪɴɢ ʀᴏᴍᴇᴏ ® ᴘᴜʙʟɪᴄ ᴇᴅɪᴛɪᴏɴ
helper.BLOCKMESS:
*💠 How to disable bot for unwanted groups 💠*

*❇️ How to get the Jid number of the group that you wants to Chat Block.*

⚙️ To get the Jid number, go to the group that you want to Chat Block. Send a command to the group as *.jid* then you will get the Jid number of that particular group.
❇️ Take the only the numbers from the Jid number that you got *(copy only the number)*.

The way you get the Jid number of that particular group :-
Chat's JID address: ```977489037858-1329946663@g.us```

From this we should only take :- *977489037858-1329946663* the numbers.

❇️ Now copy the numbers and log in to your heroku account, then go to the bot application of your bot.
❇️ Go to the settings.
❇️ You will see a button as *Reveal Config Vars* click on that button.
❇️ After that you will see the Config Vars of your Application. Now scroll down until you get *BLOCK_CHAT*
❇️ After you found BLOCK_CHAT click the editor pencil corresponding to it.Then you will go to a page with two boxes.
❇️ On the new page that you got, in the box named as *VALUE* paste the Jid number as :- 
*977489037858-1329946663,* 
❇️ The click on the *SAVE CHANGES* button.
❇️ Now click the *MORE* button in top right conner, and click on the *Restart all dynos* and restart the bot.

⚠️ When you are adding Jid number of many groups add them as :-
```xxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx,xxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx,xxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx,```

*💠 Easy way to BLOCK_CHAT. 💠*
❇️ .setvar BLOCK_CHAT=xxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx,xxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx,

ᴋɪɴɢ ʀᴏᴍᴇᴏ ® ᴘᴜʙʟɪᴄ ᴇᴅɪᴛɪᴏɴ
helper.PLUGINNOTE:
💠 *💠 *How to install Queen Amdi External Plugins?* 💠

❇️ Write *.search* command to get plugin links.
❇️ Now, choose your plugin and copy your plugin link.
❇️ Wirte *.install plugin_link* and send it.
❇️ It will simply installed.


💠 *How to remove external plugins?* 💠

❇️ Write *.plugin* to get installed plugin list.

❇️ Now, Take plugin name and type *.remove plugin_name*

ᴋɪɴɢ ʀᴏᴍᴇᴏ ® ᴘᴜʙʟɪᴄ ᴇᴅɪᴛɪᴏɴ
helper.HAPIKEY:
💠 *How to change Heroku API KEY ?* 💠

❇️ First go _*https://dashboard.heroku.com/account*_
❇️ Scoll down & you can see *Reveal* button
❇️ Touch on *Reveal* button & copy that key
❇️ Now go  _*https://dashboard.heroku.com/*_ & select your bot application
❇️ Go to Settings and scroll down you can see the *reveal config vars* button.
❇️ Touch it & scroll down you can see ther var *HEROKU_API_KEY*
❇️ Touch on the pencil . You can edit it now
❇️ Paste the API Key you copied before
❇️ After edit click *save changes* button & *restart all dynos*

ᴋɪɴɢ ʀᴏᴍᴇᴏ ® ᴘᴜʙʟɪᴄ ᴇᴅɪᴛɪᴏɴ
helper.HAPIKEY_DESC: How to change Heroku API key

greetings.WELCOME_DESC: It sets the welcome message. If you leave it blank it shows the welcome message.
greetings.NOT_SET_WELCOME:
*You don't set the welcome message yet.!*
**To set:** ```.welcome hi && hi#how are you?```
greetings.NEED_WELCOME_TEXT:
*You must write a message to set up the welcome message.*
*Example:* ```.welcome hi && hi#how are you?```
greetings.WELCOME_DELETED: *✅ Welcome message has been deleted successfully!*
greetings.WELCOME_SETTED: *✅ Welcome message has been set successfully!*
greetings.GOODBYE_DESC: Sets the goodbye message. If you leave blank, it show's the goodbye message.
greetings.NOT_SET_GOODBYE:
*You didn't set a goodbye message!*
*To set:* ```.goodbye bye && bye#see ya```
greetings.NEED_GOODBYE_TEXT:
*You must write a message to set up the goodbye message.*
*Example:* ```.goodbye bye && bye#see ya```
greetings.GOODBYE_DELETED: *✅ Goodbye message has been deleted successfully!*
greetings.GOODBYE_SETTED: *✅ Goodbye message has been setted successfully!*
